results.title: The Full Monty
results.creator_credit: Peter Cattaneo, Uberto Pasolini and Redwave Productions
results.brief_description:
Robert Carlyle stars as Gaz in this irreverent comedy set in the middle-England working class town of Sheffield. He is a jobless steel worker who dreams up an outrageous scheme to pull himself and his mates out of the personal and financial doldrums of long term unemployment. After seeing the money and adulation lauded upon the male exotic dance team The Chippendales by the females of the town, he rounds up willing and reticent participants for a review to be named the Full Monty. They are a collection of pigeon-chested, pot-bellied, heavy drinking, pale, wrinkly middle-aged strippers with one solitary gimmick - it all comes off!
Cast also includes: Tom Wilkinson, Mark Addy

results.title: Friend or foe
results.creator_credit: John Krish, Gordon L.T. Scott and Children's Film Foundation
results.brief_description: A children’s feature set in Britain during World War II that focuses on the experiences of two London boys sent to board with a farming family during the period of heavy bombing. On one particular day the pilot from a ditched German bomber saves one boy from drowning and the boys must then decide whether or not to tell the English authorities of the German’s whereabouts. Useful for discussion about the sense of war, concepts of right and wrong, the nature of friendship and loyalty, peer group pressure and family relationships. Based on the novel by Michael Morpurgo.

results.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
results.creator_credit: Milos Forman, Michael Hausman, Janet Yang, Oliver Stone and Ixtlan
results.brief_description: This is the story of the rise and rise of a self-confessed “smut-peddler”, Larry Flynt (Woody Harrelson) and his wife Althea (Courtney Love) and his building of a publishing empire, of which “Hustler” magazine is the figurehead. Along the way Flynt gets dragged to court by several exponent of the religious right, intent on defending the “decent folks”. At every turn, Larry fights back, using a tactic of high antics and retreat behind the “First Amendment”. Courted by the Pentecostal movement and Ruth Carter (Jimmy’s sister) played by Donna Hannover, he finally converts, only to give his campaign for “free speech and porn for all” the overtones of a crusade. The true life story of Larry Flynt is rich in sex, drugs, making money - and an assassination attempt. Who is Larry Flynt: a hedonistic, obnoxious pornograph or or an unlikely freedom of speech campaigner whose ardour is only tamed by drug addiction, mental illness, and Althea’s failing health? This film won two Oscar nominations to Forman and Harrelson. Winner of Golden Bear, Berlin - 1997. Includes cameos by Larry Flynt, James Carville (former Clinton ‘91 campaing director) and Donna Hannover.

results.title: Bandit Queen
results.creator_credit: Shekhar Kapur, Sundeep S Bedi, Kaleidoscope and Film Four International
results.brief_description: This movie tells the “true story” of Phoolan Devi, the Indian bandit queen who was arrested in the state of Uttar Pradesh in 1983 for kidnapping and murder and was freed in 1994 because of a change in government. As a young girl she questioned the caste restrictions around her, is married at 13 but leaves the village and her marriage in search of independence. As a young woman she is captivated by Vikram, a bandit gang member. His gang kidnaps and rapes her, Vikram kills the leader and assumes leadership with Devi. Vikram is eventually killed in a dispute over leadership after SriRam returns from prison. Initially Devi is driven by seeking vengeance over the death of her lover, but after being gang raped by SriRam in her own village she is seeking revenge for herself. This culminates in the Behmai Massacre of February 1981. Cast includes Seema Biswas, Nirmal Pandey and Govind Namdeo.

results.title: Compulsion
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Richard Zanuck, Cinema Scope Pictures and Darryl F. Zanuck
results.brief_description: Based on the true story of the Leopold-Loeb murder case, Orson Welles stars as lawyer Jonathan Wilk, whose defence against capital punishment saves the lives of two teenagers , Judd and Artie. The two homosexual teenagers were charged with murdering a young boy as an example of their intellectual superiority. Bradford Dillman and Dean Stockwell star as the two accused, one sadistic, the other submissive, in this dramatic character study based on newspaper reporter Meyer Levin’s bestseller.

results.title: Torment = Hets
results.brief_description: The storyline of this film, although simple and straightforward, reveals a beautifully observed and incise psychological drama, written by Ingmar Bergman when he was 26 years old. It is the tale of sadistic teacher in a cheerless and strict school who takes delight in exercising his reign of terror over his Latin classes. One evening as final examination time approaches, one of his students, Jan-Erik, goes to the aid of Bertha, the newsagents assistant who is drunk in the street. They become lovers, but Jan-Erik is aware of the presence of another man in her life who frightens her. He finds Bertha dead in her room and on finding the teacher in her hallway discovers he is the other man. The teacher is arrested, but is released when the cause of her death is revealed as heart failure coupled with malnutrition. Following a confrontation with the teacher in the headmasters study, Jan-Erik is expelled from school, but when the headmaster becomes aware of the teachers tyrannical methods, the boy is reinstated and the teacher punished for his crimes.

results.title: The Joy Luck Club
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass, Amy Tan and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, “The Joy Luck Club” tells the story of two generations of Chinese women. Four are mothers and wives who emigrated from China to build new lives and families in the United States. The other four are their Chinese-American daughters who are struggling to define their own identities against the expectations of their mothers and the American society where they live. Wayne Wang masterfully interweaves the stories of the eight women which spans from feudal China to modern America, highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations. “The Joy Luck Club” is a beautiful film to watch, with lavish production values which make the characters’ stories even more compelling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wayne Wang, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass, Amy Tan and Hollywood Pictures

results.title: Idiot box
results.creator_credit: David Caesar, Glenys Rowe and Central Park Films
results.brief_description: Looking for the fast track out of suburban hell, two natural born losers scheme an impossible bank heist. They feel they have strong credentials, as they spend their days watching crime dramas on television and it’s about time they put what they’ve learnt into practive. Kev, angry, unemployed, and an accident waiting to happen gets the guns. Mick, slack, cynical and also unemployed, masterminds the plan. Cast includes Ben Mendelsohn, Jeremy Sims, Robyn Loau and John Polson.

results.title: Eyes without a face
results.brief_description: Pierre Brasseur plays a surgeon who adopts extreme measures in his attempts to restore his daughter’s face (Edith Scob), horribly disfigured in a car crash. His obsessive efforts require him and his loyal assistant (Alida Valli) to kidnap young women and graft their features onto his daughter. Director Georges Franju and cinematographer Eugen Shuftan transform the pulp horror material into an eerie and surreal Cocteau-like nightmare. Eyes Without a Face has been remade twice by Spanish director Jess Franco, first as ‘The Awful Dr. Orloff’ and later as Faceless. Described by Franju as ‘an anguish film’, this film contains some haunting images, none more striking than Scob’s tortured eyes staring out from her stark, white expressionless mask. Music by Maurice Jarre. Based on a novel by Jean Redon. Also known as ‘The Horror chamber of Dr. Faustus’. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: They loved life = Canal = Kanal
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda and Zespol Filmowy KADR
results.brief_description: The second of Wajda’s unplanned war trilogy (with “A generation” and “Ashes and diamond”. A grim depiction of a defeated Poland is the central theme of this moving story of the tragic heroism of a platoon of the underground national army who were loyal to the government in exile of Poland based in London. Based on actual events, this powerful movie shows the Resistance fighters’ descent into the sewers of Warsaw to escape the Nazis during the uprising in 1944; also shown as a psychological descent into the minds of a crushed people; and a times a slow descent into hell, reminiscent of Dante. The extreme situation of their journey through the ‘kanal’ brings out the true values of their characters: their generosity, pettiness, love, courage - and the price they must pay for their faith. This film is a skilful blending of suspense with social realism and poetical vision and, following its release, became instrumental in focusing world attention on the Warsaw uprising, the Polish experience and the arrival of a new national cinema. In Polish with English sub-titles. Winner of the Silver Palm in Cannes (1957) and Gold Medal at the Moscow Film Festival (1957)
